content.question: Two disks have equal masses and radii. Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is solid, and Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is hollow. Each disk has a thin string wrapped around it. Both strings are attached to the ceiling as shown. The disks are simultaneously released from rest from the same height. Which of the following accurately describes which disk will hit the ground first and why?

choices.label: Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> will hit the ground first. Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has a greater rotational inertia; therefore, the tension in the string for Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> will be greater than the tension in the string for Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> will hit the ground first. Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> has a smaller rotational inertia; therefore, it will have a greater angular acceleration.

Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> will hit the ground first. Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has a smaller rotational inertia; therefore, it will have a greater linear acceleration.

Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> will hit the ground first. Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> has a greater rotational inertia; therefore, it will have a greater angular acceleration.
Both disks will hit the ground at the same time. Since both disks have the same mass, they will have the same linear acceleration.

content.answer: Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> will hit the ground first. Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has a smaller rotational inertia; therefore, it will have a greater linear acceleration.
